entry.title: X-Plane 12.1.4 Released in Public Beta
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. The latest version of Laminar Researchâs X-Plane, 12.1.4, is now available in public beta. This update, known as the flight lessons update, introduces numerous quality-of-life improvements, along with new flight lessons. â Flight lessons Version 12.1.4 introduces new flight lessons for beginners. The Scottish airport is known for its unique runwayâor lack thereof. Safe Mode Laminar Research is introducing a "safe mode" feature. Additional improvements were made, including new library objects and enhancements to the G1000 with the introduction of the SAR function, along with other general updates. â Refer to the X-Plane blog post for further details on the update. â Stay tuned to Threshold for news, reviews, and more. entry.title: PMDG Updates 737 Lineup & Shares 747 Previews

The 737NG lineup has been updated to v3.00.0112. This update primarily focuses on fixing the ongoing issues with the Universal Flight Tablet, trying to reduce or wholly eliminate the eternally spinning PMDG logo bug. Minor fixes on other fronts also further refine the productâs stability. â Their main plan for the 737NG lineup was to stabilize it further, and their focus has now shifted back to their upcoming products. Extra effort will eventually be put into the revamped version for MSFS 2024, with new model upgrades, sounds, and an entirely new sound engine. â The 777-200ER is still being readied for beta testing. entry.title: PMDG Publishes Optimistic Statement on MSFS 2024 SU1 Public Beta Compatibility
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. entry.title: Orbx Releases Grumman TBF Avenger for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Orbx has recently released their rendition of the Grumman TBF Avenger for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This WW2-era airplane was developed for the United States Navy and Marine Corps and eventually adopted by many air and naval aviation services worldwide. It was designed in 1940 to replace the Douglas TBD Devastator, offering an airplane that was very much in line with the technology adopted by the Axis forces at the time, in complete contrast to the Devastator, which was considered obsolete by 1939. The Avenger was designed to easily fit in aircraft carriers, with easily stowable wings that allowed way more airplanes to fit in the same carrier.Â With a maximum speed of 447 km/h, 1456km of total range, and a service ceiling of 22,600 feet, the mighty Avenger was one of the most iconic World War 2 bombers, permanently changing naval warfare.Â Crafted with Paul Bennetâs expertise (an aerobatic pilot who happens to own one of the last airworthy Avengers), the add-on features realistic aerodynamics, high-quality sounds, high-quality 3D modeling and texturing, and much more. Itâs available on OrbxDirect for roughly $17.68, requiring at least 2.23 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Fly2High Releases Akron-Canton Airport for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fly2High has recently launched its version of Akron-Canton Airport (KCAK) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. Situated in Ohio, the airport serves the cities of Akron, Canton, Cleveland, and Massillon. Each year, the airport welcomes nearly 700.000 passengers. The airport opened in 1946, initially intended for defense purposes during World War II, although its construction was delayed. In 1948, passenger flights began operating at the airport. The first terminal was established in 1955 and underwent expansions in 1962 and 2020. Today, the airport accommodates passenger airlines such as Allegiant Air, American Eagle, Breeze Airways, and United Express, along with the cargo airline Castle Aviation. These airlines offer destinations including Chicago, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, and many more. The scenery features a highly detailed rendition of the airport, main terminal interiors, custom jetways, custom lights, and more. The newly released scenery requires 3.9 GB of disk space and is available on iniBuilds for $15.59. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned to Threshold!

entry.title: FlightFX Announces Release Date for Upcoming Piaggio Avanti II for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FlightFX recently announced a release date for their upcoming Piaggio Avanti II for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, along with the release of a launch trailer and pricing information. The Piaggio Avanti II is an evolution of the Piaggio Avanti, originally introduced in late 1990 after four years of flight testing. The original concept goes even further back to 1979, when engineering studies started, and design choices were tested in wind tunnels in the subsequent years by Professor Jan Roskam from the University of Kansas and Professor Gerald Gregorek from Ohio State University. The final design choice was finally made in 1982, with the fuselage development starting a year later. The first prototype only took off in 1986, with the Italian certification to come in early 1990. The Avanti II got certified in late 2005, featuring an uprated Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-66B turboprop engines, flying faster and more economically, and a new Rockwell Collins glass cockpit set. With 70 planes ordered in the first few months after the certification, the fastest civilian turboprop twin (according to Flying Magazine) was rather successful. The add-on promises a faithful recreation of the Piaggio Avanti II. It will be available in the MSFS Marketplace for $24.99 next Thursday (06/02).Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: UK2000 Releases University of Illinois Willard Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. UK2000 Scenery recently released their rendition of the University of Illinois Willard Airport (KCMI), serving the Urbana metropolitan area, for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020.Â While it was dedicated in late 1945, airline flights were to start nearly a decade later, in 1954, albeit in a very barebones manner, as the passenger terminal was only erected in 1960. By the late 1960s, Willard was the second-busiest airport in the state. However, it crumbled within a decade after the Airline Deregulation Act of 1978. Airlines found service to smaller airports inefficient and expensive. Airfares went up, whereas they went down at bigger airports like Chicago OâHare, quickly killing the demand and leading many airlines to leave the airport altogether. A new passenger terminal was built in the late 1980s and remains used today. Until eleven years ago, the airport was home to the University of Illinois Institute of Aviation, which was voted by trustees to be closed in 2011, and everything was transferred over to Parkland College in 2013 so that the enrolled students could complete their courses.Â Parkland College still operates the airport, providing an annual subsidy of $433,000. Itâs currently served by a single airline, American Eagle, which flies passengers to Chicago OâHare and Dallas/Fort Worth.Â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with full-detail buildings, realistic ground markings, performance-friendly optimization, custom vegetation, PBR materials, custom static aircraft, custom night lighting, and more. Itâs available on SimMarket for roughly $14.84, requiring at least 70.42 MB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: IM Scenery Releases RAF Honington for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. IM Scenery recently released their rendition of RAF Honington (EGXH), a Royal Air Force station in Suffolk, England, for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024.Â Construction started in 1935 and was undertaken by John Laing & Son, an investment group now known as John Laing Group, which boasts 177 years of history. The opening occurred two years later, nearly right in time for the beginning of World War 2. Based in Honington at the start of the war, the IX Squadron ran the first British bombing raid of the Second World War, attacking the Kriegsmarine in the Baltic. In 1942, the airfield was transferred to the United States Army Air Forces and upgraded to a class A Bomber base. It was eventually transferred back to the RAF once the war was over, primarily utilized by the RAF Transport Command and later by the RAF Bomber Command in 1949. In the 1950s, a 9,000 ft concrete runway was built and completed in 1956. In the 1980s, it was selected to become a base for the RAFâs Panavia Tornado fleet, with the IX Squadron being reformed there and becoming the worldâs first operational Tornado squadron. â In mid-1992, it was decided that Honington would become an RAF Regiment Depot, with the Tornado fleet wholly leaving the airport. â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with fully custom objects with PBR textures, custom night lighting, custom ground poly, custom terraforming, and custom static aircraft. Itâs available on Contrail for roughly $8.30, requiring at least 712.1 MB of free hard disk space to install.Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â
